result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Waldron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

State speaks to the court. Atty Lawton speaks to the court.  Defendant makes statement.  
Sentencing---2  years probation on all counts + costs.  
Conditions 9pm-6am except for employment must be at residence.  Not to possess/consume any controlled substances.  Not to consume any alcohol. Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on premises except for employment.
